In this connection, publicity directors of the stations
have to be contacted. After being contacted, they must
be propelled into movement.
All this is by way of discussion. I favor the idea. I
know that the National Audience Board would help spread
the word.
I think that Harcus and Franklin Bouwsma have a good
idea there. Perhaps some wealthy individual, who would be
a declared Chairman of the National Educational Radio and
Television Week, would shell out the money to pay for the
week.
Thanks for the communication.
Best regards,
Bernard F. Kamins
BFK/mm
